data.headline: Nasdaq rose about 1% and S&P 500 gained 0.5–0.6% on 2–3% advances in Nvidia and Microsoft, with additional support from Oracle and STMicroelectronics
bullets: Dow slipped after Friday’s record close above 50,000, while the Russell 2000 outperformed with a 0.7% gain
Selective rotation out of some megacaps observed, with software stocks under pressure on AI disruption concerns
Valaris surged over 20% on deal news, marking one of the session’s biggest movers
Novo Nordisk advanced as Hims & Hers dropped sharply on increased weight-loss competition
Media stocks Nexstar and Tegna rallied after a Trump merger endorsement
Kyndryl fell following news of an SEC probe
Alphabet announced plans for a major AI-related bond issuance
Traders positioned cautiously ahead of a data-heavy week featuring jobs, CPI, and retail sales, with partial government shutdown risks in focus and no major economic releases today
